text: Brazil Russia India China Wall Street
calls them the BRICS
for the past decade they were powerful
engines of the global economy the
countries where growth just wouldn't
quit well not anymore
the BRICS are stalling and they're
stalling all at once
it began in China China's growth rate is
nearly four times that of the United
States but last quarter growth in China
fell to 7.5% the slowest pace in 15
years the problem is what happens in
China doesn't stay in China it spreads
during the boom years China bought huge
amounts of basic commodities things like
iron and oil to feed its factories and
that was great for the other BRICS which
sell those materials on world markets
only now China is buying less and
commodity prices are falling that's bad
news for the other BRICS but China's
slowdown isn't the only problem another
problem for the other BRICS is inflation
inflation in one BRIC country is hitting
six point five percent three times the
level in the US and that's Brazil rising
prices are taking a big bite out of
consumers wallets it's part of the
reason we see Brazilians taking to the
streets to protest poor public services
corruption and rising cost in India the
price of food keeps climbing hitting the
poor particularly hard the economy there
is now creeping along at just under 5%
russia's oil wealth allowed it to
prosper while the eurozone sank into
recession but a lot of that windfall was
spent so Russia's economy is slowing
just later than it might have
all of this puts the United States back
in a familiar position as an engine of
global growth take a look at the global
financial markets when the BRICS were
hot they attracted a lot of investor
dollars and stocks soared now investors
are pulling back the Russian stock
market is down nearly 10 percent this
year with Brazil down 22
